title: 5/3/2017 - "1/4" Screen & DirectX Error Issues
body:
Hey fam,

> **Update - 5/6/2017 @ 9AM Pacific**
> 
> This should now be resolved for both Mac and PC players.  If you continue to have any issues, reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can work with you individually.  

--- 
There is currently an issue where some players are only getting a small fraction of their screen or getting a DirectX error.  We're tracking the issue now and believe that it might be the result of using a custom resolution, 4K screen, or resolution exceeding 1080p.

---
> **For Mac players**:  [Example screenshot here](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/302242899322601473/309346698331947018/Screen_Shot_2017-05-03_at_11.12.37_PM.png)
> 
> Tapping Alt+Enter in-game can serve as a work around.   This will toggle you out of fullscreen and into windowed mode to restore your game screen.

-----
> **For PC players**:  This may come up as a DirectX error
> 
> Delete your **Config folder**.  This  is typically found at C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\
> 
>As a heads up this will reset your resolution, settings, and keybindings to default.
> 

----
A big shout out to all of you who helped investigate these issues with reports and screenies!    I'll continue to post updates here as they come!

In the end to me it seemed to be the resolution problem that Porocles described further below. I struggled to figure out how to access the resolution settings at all, but installing the GeForce Experience ( here you get the link for those the use GeForce https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/geforce/geforce-experience/ )
making account, verify account, login, let it track your games, click league and it should look like a 50/50 of the upper end of the game, and lower end of information, now to the centre right there is a button that says revert in a box, and a tool next to it. Click the tool! Here you can custom the settings. Put it under 1800 in resolution and in windowed... now it works pretty good!


(Guide Version #2 - Resolution issue)

SHORT VERSION

* Install GeForce Experience ( https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/geforce/geforce-experience/ )
* Create account if you dont have it already (if you can ofc, I dont know what it works with or not)
* Verify Account
* Login to account on the client
* Let GeForce Experience track your games
* Click LoL in its found list
* Look in the center right - Spanner - Clicky - Change Resolution + Alter Display mode, see what works. 

HOPE IT HELPED!

I found a fix:

Go to Riot Games/League of Legends/Config, open the game.cfg, and switch the resolution in there to your actual resolution, because it is at 1080p for some reason.

If you don't know your resolution, use http://www.whatismyscreenresolution.com/

I'm not sure if it does the exact same thing as deleting the config folder or not, but that's how I fixed it. xD

This is doable!  As long as you're not exceeding 1080p or a custom resolution.  The risk of accidentally messing up a setting in there is great, though, so I don't want to recommend manually adjusting it.  It would be easier to just remove the folder completely and have it recreate as default when getting into a game.  Kudos!
